html: With profits to be made, Big Pharma isn’t going to start self-policing its pricing practices. In order for prices to go down, Congress needs to take swift action to end business as usual in the broken drug pricing system. 2019 must be the year Congress makes that happen.
text:
With profits to be made, Big Pharma isn’t going to start self-policing its pricing practices. 

In order for prices to go down, Congress needs to take swift action to end business as usual in the broken drug pricing system. 2019 must be the year Congress makes that happen.

html: Earlier this year I called on drugmakers to commit to lowering drug prices. This week, I received responses from 7 of the largest makers of prescription drugs, and *not one* would commit to working with Congress to make prescription drugs more affordable for Americans. Shameful.
text:
Earlier this year I called on drugmakers to commit to lowering drug prices.

This week, I received responses from 7 of the largest makers of prescription drugs, and *not one* would commit to working with Congress to make prescription drugs more affordable for Americans. Shameful.

html: The rules that underpin the WTO were crafted more than 20 years ago, when China was an economic middleweight. Today, China is an economic heavyweight, and growing rapidly. Much of that growth has come at our direct expense, and in violation of WTO rules.

html: Without insurance, Jasmine’s home health assistant can’t continue to help her. That means that within days, she won’t be able to get the infusions that are keeping her alive, and she could starve.
text: Without insurance, Jasmine’s home health assistant can’t continue to help her. That means that within days, she won’t be able to get the infusions that are keeping her alive, and she could starve.

html: Then comes the government shutdown. Just a few weeks ago, Jasmine was informed that her health insurance had lapsed, and only her employer could fix it. But because Jasmine works for the federal government, her employer is shut down. Nobody’s answering the phones.
text: Then comes the government shutdown. Just a few weeks ago, Jasmine was informed that her health insurance had lapsed, and only her employer could fix it. But because Jasmine works for the federal government, her employer is shut down. Nobody’s answering the phones.

html: For years, Jasmine has been living with an inoperable brain tumor, relying on invaluable care by a home health worker to access nutritional assistance. You would not wish Jasmine’s struggle on your worst enemy, but she is confronting it with remarkable bravery.
